title: Use shap.GPUTreeExplaine on Windows
body:
Dear Developers:

The ```shap.GPUTreeExplaine``` can be used on Ubuntu, but little information I know is about running it on Windows.   

My code is:
```
explainerGPU = shap.GPUTreeExplainer(model, seed=1)
shap_values = explainerGPU.shap_values(X.iloc[0:10,:])
```

Direct running returns the message:
```
cuda extension was not built during install!
Traceback (most recent call last):

  File "C:\Users\XXX\AppData\Local\Temp\ipykernel_23528\1948042088.py", line 1, in <cell line: 1>
    shap_values = explainerGPU.shap_values(X.iloc[0:10,:])

  File "D:\Anaconda3\envs\Usegdal\lib\site-packages\shap\explainers\_gpu_tree.py", line 105, in shap_values
    assert_import("cext_gpu")

  File "D:\Anaconda3\envs\Usegdal\lib\site-packages\shap\utils\_general.py", line 25, in assert_import
    raise e

  File "D:\Anaconda3\envs\Usegdal\lib\site-packages\IPython\core\interactiveshell.py", line 3552, in run_code
    exec(code_obj, self.user_global_ns, self.user_ns)

  File "C:\Users\XXX\AppData\Local\Temp\ipykernel_23528\1948042088.py", line 1, in <cell line: 1>
    shap_values = explainerGPU.shap_values(X.iloc[0:10,:])

  File "D:\Anaconda3\envs\Usegdal\lib\site-packages\shap\explainers\_gpu_tree.py", line 105, in shap_values
    assert_import("cext_gpu")

  File "D:\Anaconda3\envs\Usegdal\lib\site-packages\shap\utils\_general.py", line 25, in assert_import
    raise e

  File "D:\Anaconda3\envs\Usegdal\lib\site-packages\IPython\core\interactiveshell.py", line 3552, in run_code
    exec(code_obj, self.user_global_ns, self.user_ns)

  File "C:\Users\XXX\AppData\Local\Temp\ipykernel_23528\1948042088.py", line 1, in <cell line: 1>
    shap_values = explainerGPU.shap_values(X.iloc[0:10,:])

  File "D:\Anaconda3\envs\Usegdal\lib\site-packages\shap\explainers\_gpu_tree.py", line 105, in shap_values
    assert_import("cext_gpu")

  File "D:\Anaconda3\envs\Usegdal\lib\site-packages\shap\utils\_general.py", line 25, in assert_import
    raise e

  File "D:\Anaconda3\envs\Usegdal\lib\site-packages\IPython\core\interactiveshell.py", line 3552, in run_code
    exec(code_obj, self.user_global_ns, self.user_ns)

  File "C:\Users\XXX\AppData\Local\Temp\ipykernel_23528\1675054601.py", line 1, in <cell line: 1>
    shap_values = explainerGPU(X.iloc[0:10,:])

  File "D:\Anaconda3\envs\Usegdal\lib\site-packages\shap\explainers\_tree.py", line 217, in __call__
    v = self.shap_values(X, y=y, from_call=True, check_additivity=check_additivity, approximate=self.approximate)

  File "D:\Anaconda3\envs\Usegdal\lib\site-packages\shap\explainers\_gpu_tree.py", line 105, in shap_values
    assert_import("cext_gpu")

  File "D:\Anaconda3\envs\Usegdal\lib\site-packages\shap\utils\_general.py", line 25, in assert_import
    raise e

  File "D:\Anaconda3\envs\Usegdal\lib\site-packages\shap\explainers\_gpu_tree.py", line 6, in <module>
    from .. import _cext_gpu

ImportError: cannot import name '_cext_gpu' from partially initialized module 'shap' (most likely due to a circular import) (D:\Anaconda3\envs\Usegdal\lib\site-packages\shap\__init__.py)
```
How to config ```shap```?

My GPU is NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1080. Is it okay?

Thank you.
